title: What are some examples of great classic crime novels? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not expert on crime novels, and I’m not actually all that fond of them unless some specific book really intrigues me. Others, more knowledgeable on the subject, should post lists superior to this one. Fyodor Dostoyevsky, Crime and Punishment, Demons, The Brothers Karamazov Dashiell Hammett, Red Harvest, The Dain Curse, The Maltese Falcon, The Glass Key Raymond Chandler, The Big Sleep; Farewell, My Lovely; The High Window; The Lady in the Lake Cornell Woolrich, Waltz into Darkness, Phantom Lady, Black Alibi Rex Stout, Some Buried Caesar, Fer-de-Lance, The Doorbell Rang James Ellroy, Clandestine, The Black Dahlia, The Big Nowhere, L. Well, I’m no expert on crime. but… I loved loved loved the following Donald Westlake two: The Hot Rock (where Dortmunder steals a jewel. Again, and again, and again.Bank Shot (Where Dortmunder steals an entire bank). SEMI SPOILER: In The Hot Rock at one point the crew of criminals have to break into an insane asylum to kidnap someone who has the safe deposit box info where the jewel is. They rob the place by utilizing a toy train (i.e. the kind you would ride at a fair) and rubber wet suits to get over an electric fence. A guard rushed in to tell the person in charge this (“men dressed all in rubber are jumping out of a train and invading the institution”), and he says “sit down and tell me about it.” Except way funnier. And it leaves us with the classic brain worm: Afghanistan Banana Stand. John Dortmunder - Wikipedia The whole Dortmunder series is great as is the darker series crime series by Westlake about Parker (sometimes found under the pen name of Richard Stark [in the Stephen King book “The Dark Half.” the bad guy is named Stark.]). Parker (Stark novels character) - Wikipedia Reading these (the older ones) is kind of like time travelling, where people got paid with cash at their jobs, and you could forge a drivers license with a pen and paper.
